hopobject.name: tor
hopobject.http_browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.120 Safari/537.36
hopobject.body:
Tor is an anonymity network that consists of thousands of nodes. These nodes are servers that provide bandwidth for the network and are often run by volunteers. The BBB, due to its capable performance and low power consumption, is an ideal candidate as a Tor relay.

 

Note: This project is for running a relay or bridge, NOT a transparent proxy like the Onion Pi.

 

Links for additional information:

  • Josh Datko's blog posts on Tor and the BeagleBone
  • Josh's HOPEX Slides describing the project
  • BeagleBone for Secret Agents, Chapter 2 (freely available), describes in detail how to run a Tor bridge and create a custom front panel.
hopobject.shortdesc: Use the BeagleBone to help protect privacy an anonymity online as a Tor relay or bridge.
